author: Staff Reporter
text:
A sum of Rs. 6 lakh, which was carried in a vehicle without appropriate documents in violation of election Model Code of Conduct (MCC), was seized on Monday.

Officials said that the car belonging to a private matriculation school was intercepted at Anbu Nagar near Anaiyur, coming under Madurai East Constituency, by one of the Static Surveillance Teams (SST). Though the person in the car claimed that the cash was being taken for depositing in a bank, officials said that there were no documents except for a small challan with just the amount written on it. The cash was seized and deposited in the treasury. The persons in possession of the cash were asked to claim it back after submitting relevant documents.

As per the MCC, which has come into force on March 4, carrying more than Rs. 50,000 without appropriate documents has been banned. Around Rs. 21 lakh has been seized in Madurai district so far. Meanwhile, Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao organised separate meetings with representatives of recognised political parties and with senior officials and Returning Officers of all the 10 constituencies on Monday. The political parties were asked to strictly adhere to the MCC.
title: Rs. 6 lakh unaccounted money seized
